elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the questions on the factual text "Rights and duties".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Name five rights and five duties of each learner.
elements.correctAnswer: Rights: Regulation of working hours; five weeks' vacation per apprenticeship year for young people up to the age of 20; compulsory lessons at vocational school count as working hours; if the school day consists of at least eight lessons, no more work is required on the same day; attendance of free subjects or support courses during working hours is permitted for up to half a day per week without deduction of salary; duties: Carry out the instructions of those responsible for vocational training; maintain business confidentiality; no undeclared work; attend vocational school regularly; full commitment to passing the qualification procedures.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What tasks does the Vocational Training Office have in the event of conflicts in the training company?
elements.correctAnswer: The Vocational Training Office has the task of advising and mediating.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Describe the path to be taken if problems arise during the apprenticeship.
elements.correctAnswer: The learner should first ask himself or herself who is responsible for which problems, then talk to a neutral person of trust and then have a discussion with the person responsible for vocational training. If the conflict cannot be resolved, the apprenticeship supervisory committee must be informed.
